intro: Bossiaea saxosa, commonly known as the mountain bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are usually small, narrow, and sometimes hairy, adapted to reduce water loss. Bossiaea saxosa is often found in heathlands and open woodlands, where it thrives in full sun.
